content.description: Same start as Walk the Dog. After 2nd bolt go straight up. Shares the anchors of Buddha and Walk the Dog.
content.location: Far right side of the wall on the high ledge, uses the same first 2 bolts of Walk the Dog.

content.description: Hard moves on a crimp traverse to go left from 2nd bolt to a good ledge and be able to clip 3rd bolt. Possible pendulum swing if the leader falls in the traverse. This was the 1st route bolted on this wall; Jan 1 1988 after the 1st ascent free soloed by Hank. Was a mildly popular toprope location for several routes at the time.
content.location: Start on the high ledge on the right side of the wall. Giant cheater stone assists with clipping the 1st bolt.

climbs.name: Patron
climbs.fa: Scott Harris, David Cardosa, Hank Caylor

content.description: The crux is going over the 2nd bolt.
content.location: Start on the left side of upper ledge that Buddha, Walk the Dog and Wowie Zowie begin on.

climbs.name: Hysteria
climbs.fa: Adam Hurst, Scott Harris, Dave Cardosa, Hank Caylor, 1988

content.description: Short and pumpy - oh and super polished and greasy! Although don't let that keep you off of it - if your at New Wall, you're already having to deal with that! Climb up to the cookie and head a little right to the chicken head and up the rail. Traverse a couple hand moves back to the left and go straight up. Most end up finishing it to the right of chains and traversing back.
content.location: Middle of New Wall, shares first bolt with Cloud Nine.  There's also a little rock bench right in front of the route...

content.description: this is a one move wonder 12, climb up to the ledge begin out and over super thin buldge using some small crimps, lockoff strength and some a toss/dyno to a jug ledge/rail.  at this point your joining the route walk the dog (11-) and is probably easy 10 from here on out...
content.location: on the right side of wall right by the big tree.  the right most route on this wall is Walk the Dog which shares bolt 4, the piton and chains with Buddha.

content.description: This is the far left wall in the area. A large portion of it fell down in 2012 but it still has some popular routes.
